node.title: Largest inland city in NSW on COVID alert after hundreds attend funeral
node.alt: A bird's eye view of Wagga Wagga.
node.description: Wagga Wagga residents are on alert for coronavirus symptoms after a person who later returned a positive test attended a large funeral last week.
node.content:
["The regional New South Wales city of Wagga Wagga is on alert\u00a0after a person who attended a large funeral\u00a0last week returned a positive coronavirus test.", "The Murrumbidgee Local Health District (MLHD) said the person went to the funeral at Chambers Park in Tolland on Friday, November 5, 2021.\u00a0", "MLHD public health director\u00a0Tracey Oakman\u00a0said about 300 people, including a large number of Indigenous people,\u00a0attended the funeral.", "\"It's always a concern, a large gathering like that,\" she said.", "", "
The funeral was held at Chambers Park in the suburb of Tolland.\u00a0(ABC Riverina: Simon Wallace)
", "The MLHD set up a pop-up testing clinic in Tolland on Monday in response to the positive case confirmation and said as of Tuesday no new cases had\u00a0been linked to the funeral.", "Anyone who attended the funeral has been asked to get tested and isolate until they receive a negative result.", "Ms Oakman said the wider Wagga Wagga community should also remain vigilant.", "\"If it's a large, outdoor gathering we have no ability to collect QR codes or get people to sign in,\" she said.", "\"I'm not sure it will become a superspreader event, but we are concerned.\"", "", "
A mobile COVID testing clinic is operating from the Tolland Community Centre.\u00a0(ABC Riverina: Simon Wallace)
", "
Large outside gathering
", "It is not the first time a funeral has sparked concerns about COVID-19 spreading, particularly within Indigenous communities.", "A funeral in the western New South Wales town of Wilcannia in August resulted in a major outbreak of the virus in that community.\u00a0", "Ms Oakman said it was a requirement that attendees of the funeral, aged 16 and above were double vaccinated.", "", "
Tracey Oakman wants the community to stay vigilant and monitor themselves for symptoms.(ABC Goulburn Murray: Mikaela Ortolan)
", "The MLHD said in response to the funeral and a positive case connected to a\u00a0Catholic primary school in the city, it was re-opening a drive-through testing clinic\u00a0which it\u00a0closed last week.\u00a0", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
